Class Square

  • java.lang.Object
    • Square

  • public class Square
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains all the necessary data for each square on the board. Works closely with JButton to make the game work. The square class contains all some permenant data and data that can be changed.

      • Square

        public Square(int n,
              int p)
        Constructor. Creates an instance of the square class.
        Parameters:
        n - gives the square the number of n
        p - gives the square the piece of p

    • Method Detail

      • getNumber

        public int getNumber()
        Returns the number of the square.
        Returns:
        the Number of the Square

      • setColor

        public void setColor(int c)
        Sets the original color of the square. Should be called only once. Permenant data. This method should be used to set the square to be either white (baseColor = 0) or black ( baseColor = 1)
        Parameters:
        c - sets the base color of this square

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        Returns the original color of this square.
        Returns:
        the Base Color of the square

      • setX

        public void setX(int x)
        Sets the X coordinate of the square to the given x parameter. Should only be called once. Permenant data.
        Parameters:
        x - sets the X coordinate to this value

      • setY

        public void setY(int y)
        Sets the Y coordinate of the square to the given x parameter. Should only be called once. Permenant data.
        Parameters:
        y - sets the Y coordinate to this value

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns the X coordinate of this square.
        Returns:
        the X coordinate of the square on the board.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns the Y coordinate of this square.
        Returns:
        the Y coordinate of the square on the board.

      • setPiece

        public void setPiece(int n)
        Gives this square a piece. 0 means no piece. 1 means white piece. 2 means red piece. 3 means white king. 4 means red king. 5 means this piece has a yellow square. 6 means that this piece is black and should never have a piece.
        Parameters:
        n - the new piece that this square has

      • getPiece

        public int getPiece()
        Returns the type of piece this square has.
        Returns:
        the piece type

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(Square that)
        This method moves the piece in this square to the square specified.
        Parameters:
        that - the square that the piece should be moved to

      • canMoveTo

        public java.lang.Boolean canMoveTo(Square that)
        This method dictates whether a move to the given square is valid. It is based on the rules of checkers.
        Parameters:
        that - takes another square as an input
        Returns:
        true of false depending whether a move is valid or not.
